Posts.Content: I have been the same and on it for 6 weeks.  I have spoke to the oncologist who has said to give it a few more weeks as it may settle down but if not will look at changing it for something else.  Hope it settles for you.  lol Sue x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen ..... depression

Posts.Content: Thank you for everyones support, you prove it can be done, just need to get my head around it.  Perhaps with book/CD and fake cigs I can do it anyway going to give it a try.  Good wishes to everyone lol Sue x
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Thank you that is what I am trying to do.  It is a very stressful time and need them as a crutch.  I was over 20 a day before Christmas and have now cut down to about 5 but do need those to keep going.  I am hoping that these 5 will eventually go to.  Take care, keep smiling Sue x
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Still on 5 a day, I think at the moment the stress is too great to completely stop which is what I have been advised.  Hopefully when all this is over I can stop.  The E-cigs are good but I use lozengers instead of a cig during the day.  Good luck with your results and trying to stop.  Keep me informed. Sue x
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: If you see if your local chemist or even pharmacy at Tesco have a stopping cession clinic you only see a member of staff in a separate room.  It is very discreet.  However it appears that you are doing ok, good luck with stop stopping and treatment. Sue x
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: You do whatever is best for you.  I did speak to my doctor about this and she said you are under too much stress at the moment, you will do it when you are ready just cut down and this is what I have done.  I have tried to stop on numerous occasions having spoken over 20 for 44 years and you cannot just switch it off straight away.  Good luck with your treatment and stopping smoking sue x
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Thank you.  I have been smoking for 44 years, a long while.  I must make an effort to try to stop the problme is that smoking is my crutch,  and my husband is still smoking.  Need to send hm away for a few weeks!!  You did wonderful to stop and keep stopped, congratulations. lol sue
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Thank you, everyone is surprised when I say I am still smoking.  They think because I have been diagnosed with cancer I can just say "no more" and its not that easy.  I will send for the book and CD, thank you.  Take care lol sue
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: I think that might be the way for me, although I have tried before and am soon back up to 20 a day.  You have done really well, I don't think people who haven't smoked understand how hard it is, people say you just haven't got the willpower!!  Thank you for everyones reply, felt very guilty at still smoking.. lol sue
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Have you been to a quit smoking group.  I don't go to a group but my local chemist, they will advice you and ensure that you reduce the strength when necessary until you are on the lowest dose and then can stop the patches.  They are very good with advice and help. Sue x
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: I have been diagnosed with BC and had operation.  I smoke 20 cigs a day and know that I should cease this habit, however due to stress of the BC and being scared I am finding this very difficult.  Can anyone offer any advice please, I have tried patches, gum etc., you name it I have tried it.  lol sue
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Thank you.  Well done to everyone who has managed to stop and keep at it to those who are nearly there.  I hope that in a few weeks I can say I am a non-smoking or at least I only smoke 1 or 2 a day.  lol sue
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Thank you for your comments and words of support.  New to this and as I am sure to most the diagnosis came as a complete shock.  I will try switching to evening but will take advice and speak to breast care nurse.  Again thank you feel better for reading your blog x
Posts.Title: PMS and Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Not suffering range but been on Tamoxifen for ten days and suffering with bad anxiety and waking up early in the morning with a fear of complete doom, does anyone else get this affect?  Thank you for reading.
Posts.Title: PMS and Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Reiki is spiritual healing using universal energy.  You have to ask for Reiki and I think this is what she is talking about, you should also pay for it in some way, don't know why, It can be just a penny.  I have had Reiki for over two years and found it very calming.  sue c x
Posts.Title: Reiki

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow, hope it is good news.  LOL Sue
Posts.Title: its spread so scared

Posts.Content: I suffer with anxiety and depression and this is getting worse on the tamoxifen.  The doctor has prescribed citaloprin but I have read that this can react with the tamoxifen.  Is anyone on these or can give some advice.  Many thanks
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and Citaloprin

Posts.Content: Thank you to everyone for their advice.  I do need something so will have a go.  Good luck and keep smiling to everyone xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and Citaloprin

Posts.Content: I think that others will agree that after the op there are numerous lumps and bumps.  I had my operation on 2nd January and have a lump which I think may be from the operation.  I have seen onchologist who has not raised any concerns.  i also have the long vein type under the breast where the lump was removed.  Take care sue x
Posts.Title: Feeling in breast

Posts.Content: Welcome to the group.  I am sure that you will find this a useful site, everyone is lovely and will give you appropriate advice.  Take care and keep smiling.  lol Sue x
Posts.Title: New to the group

Posts.Content: Don't worry too much I know it is easier said than done.  I have had several friends who have found lumps only to be told that they were cysts and they had them drained.  They get the appointments through pretty quick and will do all the necessary tests.  Try to be positive until after your appointment and just remember that if it is cancer the survival rate is extremely good.  I was diasgnosed with breast cancer middle of December and had the operation in January so they do not waste time.  Hopefully you will have positive news from your appointment.  Fingers crossed for you.
Posts.Title: Painful Lump

Posts.Content: Good luck, we are all thinking about you as we have all been in that position.  lol Simba196
Posts.Title: Painful Lump

Posts.Content: I am also on tamoxifen and amitryptaline, the doctor did put me on citalopram but there is less inter-reaction will the amitryptaline so I have just up my dose.  The oncologist is happy with this Sue x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and Venlafaxine - anyone taking both?

Posts.Content: I am finding the opposite.  I am three weeks post op and have been working from home and going into work for a few hours every week.  They want me to go back until treatment starts and then part-time whilst having treatment.  My doctor said it was my call as some people like to go back to keep busy.  I think you should decided what is best for you and push for that. lol sue
Posts.Title: Fit notes
